trans-unit.source: Mac OS X policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Mac OS X devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Mac OS X devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Mac OS X devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Mac OS X devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: General configuration policy settings
trans-unit.target: General configuration policy settings

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Mac OS X general configuration policy** to configure settings for:
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Mac OS X general configuration policy** to configure settings for:

trans-unit.source: **Device security settings**.
trans-unit.target: **Device security settings**.

trans-unit.source: Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
trans-unit.target: Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Compliant and noncompliant apps**.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant and noncompliant apps**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.

trans-unit.source: The Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).
trans-unit.target: The Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).

trans-unit.source: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it by using a Mac OS X custom policy that lets you import settings you created by using the Apple Configurator tool.
trans-unit.target: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it by using a Mac OS X custom policy that lets you import settings you created by using the Apple Configurator tool.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "Custom policy settings" later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see "Custom policy settings" later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Password settings
trans-unit.target: Password settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Require a password to unlock devices
trans-unit.target: Require a password to unlock devices

trans-unit.source: Specify whether the user must use a password to access their Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether the user must use a password to access their Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: **Important:** Unlike iOS devices, on Mac OS X devices, the user is not immediately notified to update their password to comply with this setting.
trans-unit.target: **Important:** Unlike iOS devices, on Mac OS X devices, the user is not immediately notified to update their password to comply with this setting.

trans-unit.source: Required password type
trans-unit.target: Required password type

trans-unit.source: Specify whether the password can be **Numeric** only, or whether it must be **Alphanumeric** (contain letters and numbers).
trans-unit.target: Specify whether the password can be **Numeric** only, or whether it must be **Alphanumeric** (contain letters and numbers).

trans-unit.source: **Important:** This setting is supported only on Mac OS X version 10.10.3 and later.
trans-unit.target: **Important:** This setting is supported only on Mac OS X version 10.10.3 and later.

trans-unit.source: Number of complex characters required in password
trans-unit.target: Number of complex characters required in password

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of complex characters required in the password (**0** to **4**).
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of complex characters required in the password (**0** to **4**).

trans-unit.source: A complex character is a symbol, such as **?**.
trans-unit.target: A complex character is a symbol, such as **?**.

trans-unit.source: Minimum password length
trans-unit.target: Minimum password length

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum length for the password (**4** to **14** characters).
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum length for the password (**4** to **14** characters).

trans-unit.source: Allow simple passwords
trans-unit.target: Allow simple passwords

trans-unit.source: Allow the use of simple passwords such as **0000** or **1234**.
trans-unit.target: Allow the use of simple passwords such as **0000** or **1234**.

trans-unit.source: Minutes of inactivity before password is required
trans-unit.target: Minutes of inactivity before password is required

trans-unit.source: Specify how long the computer must be inactive before a password is required to unlock it.
trans-unit.target: Specify how long the computer must be inactive before a password is required to unlock it.

trans-unit.source: Password expiration (days)
trans-unit.target: Password expiration (days)

trans-unit.source: Specify how many days elapse before the user must change the password (**1** to **255** days).
trans-unit.target: Specify how many days elapse before the user must change the password (**1** to **255** days).

trans-unit.source: Remember password history
trans-unit.target: Remember password history

trans-unit.source: Prevent the user from using a previously used password.
trans-unit.target: Prevent the user from using a previously used password.

trans-unit.source: When this is set, you can also set **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be reused (**1** to **24**).
trans-unit.target: When this is set, you can also set **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be reused (**1** to **24**).

trans-unit.source: Minutes of inactivity before screensaver activates
trans-unit.target: Minutes of inactivity before screensaver activates

trans-unit.source: Specify the length of time that the computer must be idle before the screensaver is activated.
trans-unit.target: Specify the length of time that the computer must be idle before the screensaver is activated.

trans-unit.source: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list for Mac OS X**, enable **Managed settings for devices**, and then specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps by using the following information.
trans-unit.target: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list for Mac OS X**, enable **Managed settings for devices**, and then specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps by using the following information.

trans-unit.source: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

trans-unit.source: Intune lets you report devices with noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: Intune lets you report devices with noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: It does not block installation or remove noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: It does not block installation or remove noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
trans-unit.target: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

trans-unit.source: Displays the Mac OS X apps that users are not allowed to install.
trans-unit.target: Displays the Mac OS X apps that users are not allowed to install.

trans-unit.source: If users install any of these apps, they will be reported in **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.
trans-unit.target: If users install any of these apps, they will be reported in **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.

trans-unit.source: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed
trans-unit.target: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed

trans-unit.source: Displays the Mac OS X apps that users are allowed to install.
trans-unit.target: Displays the Mac OS X apps that users are allowed to install.

trans-unit.source: If users install any other apps, they will be reported in **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.
trans-unit.target: If users install any other apps, they will be reported in **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: Add an app to the selected list.
trans-unit.target: Add an app to the selected list.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the bundle ID of the app.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the bundle ID of the app.

trans-unit.source: **Tip:** To find the bundle ID of an app, use the following steps on a Mac computer that has the app installed:
trans-unit.target: **Tip:** To find the bundle ID of an app, use the following steps on a Mac computer that has the app installed:

trans-unit.source: Open the folder in which the app is installed (for example, **/Applications**).
trans-unit.target: Open the folder in which the app is installed (for example, **/Applications**).

trans-unit.source: Select the *<App Name>***.app** bundle, and choose **Show Package Contents**.
trans-unit.target: Select the *<App Name>***.app** bundle, and choose **Show Package Contents**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Info.plist** file.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Info.plist** file.

trans-unit.source: Check the value associated with the key **CFBundleIdentifier**.
trans-unit.target: Check the value associated with the key **CFBundleIdentifier**.

trans-unit.source: The format for the bundle ID is **com.contoso.appname**.
trans-unit.target: The format for the bundle ID is **com.contoso.appname**.

trans-unit.source: Import Apps
trans-unit.target: Import Apps

trans-unit.source: Import a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
trans-unit.target: Import a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

trans-unit.source: In the file, use this format: app name, publisher, app bundle ID.
trans-unit.target: In the file, use this format: app name, publisher, app bundle ID.

trans-unit.source: Edit
trans-unit.target: Edit

trans-unit.source: Edit the name, publisher, and app bundle ID of the selected app.
trans-unit.target: Edit the name, publisher, and app bundle ID of the selected app.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: Delete the selected app from the list.
trans-unit.target: Delete the selected app from the list.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Intune reports, see [Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports](understand-microsoft-intune-operations-by-using-reports.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Intune reports, see [Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports](understand-microsoft-intune-operations-by-using-reports.md).

trans-unit.source: When a Mac OS X device is in sleep mode, policies and profiles cannot be delivered or inventoried.
trans-unit.target: When a Mac OS X device is in sleep mode, policies and profiles cannot be delivered or inventoried.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the Intune console might temporarily display the status **Policy settings in error** until the next time the device wakes from sleep mode.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the Intune console might temporarily display the status **Policy settings in error** until the next time the device wakes from sleep mode.

trans-unit.source: Monitor compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Monitor compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: Use **Noncompliant Apps Reports** to view the compliance of apps that you specified.
trans-unit.target: Use **Noncompliant Apps Reports** to view the compliance of apps that you specified.

trans-unit.source: To run a report
trans-unit.target: To run a report

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Reports**.

trans-unit.source: Select the device groups that you want to check, select whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, and then choose **View Report**.
trans-unit.target: Select the device groups that you want to check, select whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, and then choose **View Report**.

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Mac OS X custom configuration policy** to deploy settings that you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12) to Mac OS X devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Mac OS X custom configuration policy** to deploy settings that you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12) to Mac OS X devices.

trans-unit.source: This tool lets you create many settings that control the operation of these devices and export them to a configuration profile.
trans-unit.target: This tool lets you create many settings that control the operation of these devices and export them to a configuration profile.

trans-unit.source: You can then import this configuration profile into an Intune Mac OS X custom policy and deploy the settings to users and devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: You can then import this configuration profile into an Intune Mac OS X custom policy and deploy the settings to users and devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: This capability allows you to deploy Mac OS X settings that are not configurable with the Intune Mac OS X general configuration policy.
trans-unit.target: This capability allows you to deploy Mac OS X settings that are not configurable with the Intune Mac OS X general configuration policy.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you start, you must have installed the Apple Configurator and created a configuration file that contains the settings you want to deploy to users or devices.
trans-unit.target: Before you start, you must have installed the Apple Configurator and created a configuration file that contains the settings you want to deploy to users or devices.

trans-unit.source: You can download and learn about the Apple Configurator from [the Mac App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12).
trans-unit.target: You can download and learn about the Apple Configurator from [the Mac App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12).

trans-unit.source: Intune does not report the compliance of individual settings in a Mac OS X custom policy.
trans-unit.target: Intune does not report the compliance of individual settings in a Mac OS X custom policy.

trans-unit.source: However, the overall compliance of the policy is reported.
trans-unit.target: However, the overall compliance of the policy is reported.

trans-unit.source: General settings
trans-unit.target: General settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the Mac OS X custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the Mac OS X custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Mac OS X custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Mac OS X custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: Custom settings
trans-unit.target: Custom settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)
trans-unit.target: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the policy as it will be displayed on the device and in Intune policy reports.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the policy as it will be displayed on the device and in Intune policy reports.

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile file
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile file

trans-unit.source: Choose **Import**, and then browse to the configuration profile that you created by using the Apple Configurator.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Import**, and then browse to the configuration profile that you created by using the Apple Configurator.

trans-unit.source: **Tip:** See "How to create a configuration profile file" in this topic for help in creating the configuration profile.
trans-unit.target: **Tip:** See "How to create a configuration profile file" in this topic for help in creating the configuration profile.

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile details
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile details

trans-unit.source: Display the XML code for the configuration profile that you imported.
trans-unit.target: Display the XML code for the configuration profile that you imported.

trans-unit.source: How to create a configuration profile file
trans-unit.target: How to create a configuration profile file

trans-unit.source: You can create the configuration profile file used by the custom policy in two ways:
trans-unit.target: You can create the configuration profile file used by the custom policy in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Export the file (with the extension **.mobileconfig**) from the Apple Configurator tool.
trans-unit.target: Export the file (with the extension **.mobileconfig**) from the Apple Configurator tool.

trans-unit.source: Author the file yourself by using the appropriate schema from the [Apple Configuration Profile Key Reference](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/featuredarticles/iPhoneConfigurationProfileRef/Introduction/Introduction.html).
trans-unit.target: Author the file yourself by using the appropriate schema from the [Apple Configuration Profile Key Reference](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/featuredarticles/iPhoneConfigurationProfileRef/Introduction/Introduction.html).

trans-unit.target: See also
